resources.string: Display the source code of the trigger\'s action
Disable trigger to skip future firings.
Sensors & probes enabled and collecting readings…
Transmissions enabled when Wi-Fi is present.
Transmissions enabled when Wi-Fi is present and the device is plugged-in.
Transmissions enabled when the device is pluggged-in.
Would you like to remove all the time points collected?\n\nThis action cannot be undone.
Enter a name and tap the button below to mark a time point.

Would you like to clear this time point?

%1$s
%2$s

This action cannot be undone.

The collected time points are attached.

-Purple Robot
Query any third-party update services (HockeyApp) for application updates & bug fixes.
This change will take effect the next time this application restarts.
When set, the app will hash the name and phone numbers observed when collecting that data.
Transmits message text with event metadata.

Setting this option to true will transmit the contents of outgoing messages (sent from this device) to the server automatically. This option should only be enabled under extremely rigorous oversight by an authorized privacy official or institutional review board.
Exceeded current user\'s Fitbit rate limit. Will resume data collection within the next hour.
Encrypts any transmitted message contents before sending to the server.
When set, the app will hash the caller\'s name and phone number when collecting that data.
Override the default upload intervals with a constant interval.
Interval to pause between upload sessions.
Override the default upload payload size with a constant size.
Please enter the URL for the application configuration file.
Clears ALL configuration settings and returns Purple Robot to its original state.
Are you sure you want to clear the configuration? This will remove ALL settings, triggers, snapshots, and device readings.
Default pattern used to provide haptic feedback (vibrations) for events.
System sound used for audible notifications when not otherwise specified.
Please enter the password required to configure this launcher.
Unique identifier used to associate your data with your online profile.
When probes are disabled, specifies whether to display the default placeholder image or to leave the area empty.
Do not display sanity check notifications.
Unable to automatically set configuration from the web while the password is set.

How often configuration should be refreshed from the server.
Generates a random number when requested.
A wake lock overrides the power management of the system. An active wake lock will consume more power rapidly.
Please enter a label name and value before proceeding.
Please select a timestamp from the timeline to proceed.
Time of Most Recent Phone Call
Set the mimimum threshold to determine if a new reading is signal or noise.
HTTP uploader that adjusts its behavior in response to available connectivity.
URL of the HTTP endpoint where sensor data will be logged.
Disable uploads using cellular and other mobile connection types.
Disable uploads when the mobile device is only using battery power and is not plugged in to a power source (wall socket or USB port).
Disable log uploads when the mobile device is only using battery power and is not plugged in to a power source (wall socket or USB port).
Encrypt the collected sensor data on the local device and in transmissions.
Accept all SSL certificates, regardless whether they validate properly.
Save data transmitted to the server on the local device for later review.
Persist data prior to transmission in an publicly-accessible location on the device.
Please enter a label and value that describes this time.
Observes visible GPS satellites to help determine location, cloud cover, and other information.
Collects information about software installed and running on the current device.
Measures the acceleration applied to the device. All values are in SI units (m/s^2).
Measures the acceleration applied to the Android Wear device. All values are in SI units (m/s^2).
Measures the acceleration applied to the device. All values are in SI units (m/s^2).
Measures the gravitational force applied to the device. All values are in SI units (m/s^2).
Measures the orientation of the device as a combination of an angle and an axis, in which the device has rotated through an angle Θ around an axis [x, y, z].

Identical to the rotation vector probe, but uses a magnetometer instead of using a gyroscope. This uses less power than the probe, because it doesn\'t use the gyroscope. However, it is more noisy and will work best outdoors.
Measures the acceleration applied to the device (minus the gravity). All values are in SI units (m/s^2).
Measures angular speed around each axis.
Measures angular speed around each axis.
Detects the ambient light level in SI lux units.
Detects the ambient light level in SI lux units.
Detects the ambient light level in SI lux units.
Detect the local magnetic field. Can be used as to detect the earth\'s magnetic field, but may be distorted by metal objects around device.
Detect the magnetic field from an Android Wear device. Can be used as to detect the earth\'s magnetic field, but may be distorted by metal objects around device.
Records the pressure on the touch screen of the devices.
How far the front of the device is from an object.
Information about the type and current state of the battery in the device.
Information about the type and current state of the battery in the Android Wear device.
Counts the number of steps taken since the last restart.
Observes whether the mobile phone is idle or in use.
Generates statistics and counts about phone, SMS, and other communication uses.
Details about the specific hardware the device is running, including component identifiers.
Records the most accurate location available for the device, given device limitations and respecting battery life.
Variation of the location probe, but with battery conservation functionality removed for testing purposes.
Location probe using Google Play Services\' location features.
Summarizes the current state of the Purple Robot app, including the amount of data to be transmitted to the server.
Records when the screen turns off and on.
Records available wireless (WiFi) access points and relevant connection information.
Discovers available media routers (such as Chromecast devices).
Fetches device information from a Shion home automation deployment.
Records telephony hardware, software, and account information.
Indicates whether the device is in use.
Counts the number of nearby location types.
Details about the apps the device is currently running.
Current network configuration of the active interface.
Generates random floating point numbers at a 4Hz frequency for diagnostic purposes.
Save & transmit random values generated to the remote server.
Generates aggregate statistics that describe the user\'s phone call activity, include counts of daily calls.
Acquires the latest weather data for the user\'s location from a nearby Weather Underground station.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming accelerometer data.
Provides basic frequency analyses for incoming accelerometer data.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming gyroscope data.
Collects data from a Pebble smartwatch.
Collects activity count data from a Pebble smartwatch running the Livewell watchface.
Collects activity count data from local device.
Collects activity count data from an Android Wear device.
Permit logging of diagnostic events for tracking device functionality & user behavior.
HTTP or HTTPS endpoint providing logging services.
Only upload log events when a wireless LAN is available.
How frequently logs may be uploaded to the server.
Include last known location with log events.
Calculates whether it is day or night and the times for sunrise and sunset.
Distributed Computing Laboratory, Emory University (Public Domain)
Ken Anderson, Tim Hickey, Peter Norvig, et al. (zlib/libpng License)
Arthur van Hoff, Rich Blair, Pierre Frisch, et al. (Apache License 2.0)
U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
No problems or warnings. System operation is normal.
A very significant number of log events are awaiting transmission. Connect your device to the network as soon as possible.
A significant number of log events log events are awaiting transmission. Connect your device to the network soon.
Less than 4MB of space is available on local storage.
Less than 10MB of space is available on local storage.
Less than 4MB of space is available on external storage (SD Card).
Less than 10MB of space is available on external storage (SD Card).
Unable to inspect external storage (SD Card).
Sensor data has not ever been uploaded.
Sensor data has not been uploaded in the last day.
Sensor data has not been uploaded in the last 12 hours.
Purple Robot will not function properly unless exempt from battery optimization.
Current sensor acquisition exceeds the available outbound bandwidth.
Current sensor acquisition consumes a significant amount of the available outbound bandwidth.
Unable to compare available bandwidth with current sensor data acquisition rates.
Google Play Services are out of date.
Google Play Services are working properly.
%1$s trigger defined using both FREQ=MINUTELY and BYMINUTE, introducing performance issues.
The connected Android Wear device is running low on power. Please charge the device soon.
Data uploads are restricted to WiFi networks, but the device\'s WiFi connection is disabled.
Data uploads are restricted to WiFi networks, but the device\'s WiFi connection is disabled and a significant amount of data is accumulating on the device.
Data uploads are restricted to when the device is plugged-in and a significant amount of data is accumulated. Please plug in the device to upload the accumulated files.
Multiple data upload plugins are currently enabled. This will likely result in duplicate readings at the data destination.
Required location services are currently disabled. Tap here to correct the issue.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming light sensor data.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming pressure sensor data.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming proximity sensor data.
Provides basic descriptive statistics for incoming temperature sensor data.
Records basic information from the local calendar, including elements like the day of the week, week of the month, month of the year, etc.
Month of Year %1$d, Week of Month %2$d, Day of Week %3$d
Calculates the distance from significant locations in the local address book.
When set, the app will hash the name and addresses of locations when collecting that data.
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS distance_history(_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, name TEXT, distance REAL, timestamp INTEGER DEFAULT 0);
The HTTP data upload interval is less than 10 minutes. Consider extending this interval to extend battery life. (Settings → HTTP Upload Settings →HTTP Upload Interval)
The configuration refresh interval is less than 10 minutes. Consider extending this interval to extend battery life. (Settings → Refresh Interval)
The probe named \'%1$s\' does not exist for trigger %2$s.
Retrieves information from the your online Fitbit profile.
Tap to go to the Fitbit website and login to give this device access to your activity data.
Tap to clear your Fitbit login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the Fitbit website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your Fitbit account.
Retrieves information from the your online Fitbit profile. This is a beta probe and should not be used in production capacities.
Retrieves information from the your online Jawbone profile.
Please login to the Jawbone website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your Jawbone account.
Tap to go to the Jawbone website and login to give this device access to your activity data.
Tap to clear your Jawbone login information and revoke access to this device.
Retrieves activity data from the your GitHub account.
Please login to the GitHub website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your GItHub account.
Tap to go to the GitHub website and login to give this device access to your activity data.
Tap to clear your GitHub login information and revoke access to this device.
Allow the probe to request more information once a sufficient amount of data has been collected
Please provide some information about your friends and family to help the system function better.
Tap a colored box to zoom into a cluster.
Please provide some information about places you have visited to help the system function better.
Please see the attached file for the app configuration schema.
Extracts information about the audible environment at regular intervals.
Periodically creates a recording of the audio environment.
Logs phone calls and text messages as sensor events.
Limits the number of dialog views that will stack upon each other before older dialogs are deleted.
Records when different apps come to the top of the user\'s task stack.
Collects profile & behavioral data from Facebook.
Encrypts the contents of outgoing messages and posts to your Facebook wall.
Please login to Facebook to complete the setup of the Facebook Probe.
%1$d Posts in the Last Hour, %2$d Posts in the Last Day
1 Post in the Last Hour, %1$d Posts in the Last Day
%1$d Posts in the Last Hour, 1 Post in the Last Day
1 Post in the Last Hour, 1 Post in the Last Day
Tap to go to login to Facebook and grant this device access to your posts and statuses.
Tap to clear your Facebook login information and revoke access to this device.
Collects profile data & tweets from Twitter.
Encrypts the contents of posted tweets.
Tap to go to the Twitter website and login to give this device access to your tweets.
Tap to clear your Twitter login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the Twitter website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your Twitter account.
Collects profile data & posts from Instagram.
Encrypts the contents of data retrieved from Instagram.
Tap to go to the Instagram website and login to give this device access to your posts.
Tap to clear your Instagram login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the Instagram website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your Instagram account.
Collects profile data & posts from LinkedIn.
Encrypts the contents of data retrieved from LinkedIn.
Tap to go to the LinkedIn website and login to give this device access to your posts.
Tap to clear your LinkedIn login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the LinkedIn website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your LinkedIn account.
Collects activity from Foursquare as well as names for current locations.
Tap to go to the Foursquare website and login to give this device access to your activity.
Tap to clear your Foursquare login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the Foursquare website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your Foursquare account.
Retrieves check-ins and other activity from your account.
Uses Google Play services to categorize the user\'s activity based on sensor readings.
When checked, records 5 seconds of audio from the microphone immediately after a snapshot is created.
No sensor data to associate with snapshot…
You have successfully connected Purple Robot to your online account.
You have 1 action or issue to resolve.
You have %1$d actions or issues to resolve.
When possible, compare running configuration with network configuration to detect missing or changed values.
Shared settings used by all data upload plugins.
Beta uploader that improves CPU utilization and battery life. (Beta)
No triggers are currently configured on this device.
No user-accessible triggers are currently available.
Snapshot not found. Check that you provided a valid "timestamp" parameter.
Fetches data collected & predicted by the SAINT sensing & activity recognition library.
Basic Purple Robot Health Probe Tests
Test time: a minute or less (%1$d tests)
Test time: a minute or less (1 test)
Please select one or more tests
Captures data about user touch interactions.
An example probe that emits basic audio features to illustrate how to create new probes.
A collection of accelerometer and gyroscope features used by CBITs P20 project.
Generates an event when the device detects sudden motion.
Place your device near the item to scan it.
This device does not have the necessary hardware to support NFC scanning.
Generates readings when NFC tags are scanned.
Required permissions are missing. Tap here to grant the required permissions.
Please install the Pebble companion app to use the Pebble Watch probe.
Please connect your Pebble device to the Pebble companion app.
Please install the Android Wear companion app to use the Android Wear probe.
Generate heartbeat status events on regular intervals.
Desired cryptographic hash function for protecting sensitive information.
Enable the HTTP server running on the local device. This is used primarily for inter-app communication via the scripting endpoints.
Password to allow access to the local HTTP server via HTTP Basic Authentication
Retrieves information from the your online iHealth profile.
Tap to go to the iHealth website and login to give this device access to your activity data.
Tap to clear your iHealth login information and revoke access to this device.
Please login to the iHealth website from the settings to grant Purple Robot access to your iHealth account.
Retrieves sensor data from a connected Android Wear device.
Immediately sends a request to the mobile device for buffered data.
Multiple Pebble probes are currently enabled. Please disable all but one.
Would you like to remove the reading associated with "%1$s" from the main display?
Received data from an obsolete Livewell Pebble watchface. Please upgrade your watchface.
Your device is likely to experience widespread instability due to a system memory leak, causing Purple Robot and other apps to crash. Please restart your device to reclaim the leaked resources.
Unable to configure microphone to collect audio frequency and power levels.
No readings recorded yet. Enable the probe to continue.
Authenticated connection required for inspecting probe readings.
Enables a buffer where readings are stored for a limited duration before being discarded. The buffer contents may be flushed with a script command.
Allow devices on the local network to discover embedded website.
Unique identifier for this device to be used in discovery name.

The attached ZIP file contains a static Bootstrap site.

Enjoy!

-Purple Robot

The attached ZIP file contains a collection of static Jekyll pages.

Enjoy!

-Purple Robot
Reports details about wake locks that affect power management and efficiency.
Wake Locks: %1$d Partial, %2$d Dim, %3$d Bright, %4$d Full
The audio capture probe is currently recording…

A custom Weather Underground API key is required for fetching weather data. Please obtain one and enter it in the Settings. (Probe Configuration → External Service Probes → Weather Underground → API Key)
Please enter a custom API key obtained from Weather Underground.
Unable to fetch location information. Tap here to inspect your system settings.
Select the time interval between probes\' fresh data checks.
Some probes are unable to collect data due to missing Bluetooth hardware components. Please select a different device for use with this configuration.
Required Bluetooth features are currently disabled. Tap here to re-enable Bluetooth features.
Purple Robot requires Google Play, but this does not appear to be available on your device.
Tap here to grant Purple Robot access to the app usage data that its configuration requires.
Unable to access the app usage system settings. Please locate the setting and grant Purple Robot access.
Unable to gather app launch events
This version of Android is unable to report app launch events in a stable and consistent fashion. This information will be unavailable to Purple Robot until a future system update.
Unable to gather running app information
This version of Android is unable to report running app activity in a stable and consistent fashion. This information will be unavailable to Purple Robot until a future system update.
Permission not granted. System may not function properly until permission is granted…
Purple Robot does not yet have all its required permissions.
Determines how readings from this probe are transmitted to a remote server.
Are you sure you want to clear the property %1$s = %2$s?
Please enter a valid property value…
Please enter a valid property name…
Enter the name and value of the property to attach to the uploaded timestamps.
Tip: Use \"Probe\" as the property name to log the points under a predefined probe name (instead of the time point name).
Launches main screen once a day to mitigate unwanted app termination.
Enables Purple Robot to manage device features on Samsung devices.
This app must be authorized with Knox in order to transmit data reliably.
This Samsung device must be registered with the included Knox management software to function reliably.
